data.title: Obituaries Granite City, Illinois
data.text:
Donald C. Bono, 85, of Granite City passed away Saturday, May 27, 2017. He was born January 19, 1932 in

Granite City to Willard and Flosie (Clark) Bono.

He worked for 28 years at Dow Chemical and another 10 years at SCI in Madison as a foreman. Donald served his country in the Marine Corps during the

Korean War. He was a member of the Granite City Eagles.

He is survived by his sister, Lorrine Brandes of Granite City nephews Edward F. (Donna) Brandes Jr and Dean Olive of Granite City and great niece,

Caslyn Brandes of Granite City.

He was preceded in death by his parent; sister, Loretta Olive and two brothers, Bobby and Raymond Bono.

Cremation services entrusted to Wojstrom Funeral Home & Crematory in Granite City.

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Charles “Chuck” E. Westbrook, 69, of Pontoon Beach died on Wednesday, May 24, 2017 at Anderson Hospital

in Maryville, IL.

He was born on September 15, 1947 in Granite City, IL to Howard and Kathern nee: Hoffman Westbrook.

Charles married his childhood sweetheart, Carol Nacy.

The loving husband and father was of the Lutheran faith. He was a member of the Granite City Moose Lodge 272 since 1973 and a member of the Granite

City Eagles since 1994 and also an associate member of the Pontoon Beach AmVets.. Charles was a manager at Tri City Rental for 20 years, he also

worked as an Animal Control Officer and Health Inspector for Pontoon Beach for 15 years until his health started failing. He enjoyed hunting, fishing, and

cooking for lodges. Charles was known for his tacos and enchiladas.

Besides his wife, Charles is survived by a brother, Rick (Kathy) Westbrook of Dow, IL; 3 daughters: Kathyrn (Joe) Kelly of Chester, IL, Tammy (Robert)

Flood of Arnold, MO and Carol Westbrook and her significant other, Jack Gidney of Park Hills, MO; 7 grandchildren: Tiffany, Brennen, Brittany, Kelsey,

Kristal, Brett and Grant and 8 great grandchildren. Also surviving is a step-daughter, Gina (Terry) Millard of Havelock, NC; a step grandson, Kurtis and

three step-granddaughters: Jennifer, Tracy and Shannon and 7 step great grandchildren. Charles will be greatly missed by many nieces, nephews,

cousins and many friends including his dear friends, Gail Buenger and Diana Barthalomy.

Charles is preceded in death by his parents and 3 brothers: Pete Westbrook, Donald Westbrook and David Westbrook.

Cremation services entrusted to the care of Wojstrom Funeral Home & Crematory of Granite City.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Helen M. Hutton, 91, of Pontoon Beach died on Wednesday, May 24, 2017 at her home.

She was born on September 22, 1925 in Springfield, IL to John and Julia (nee: Krmel) Phillipich.

She is survived by a son, Morris Jack Brown of Bunker Hill, IL; three grandchildren, Justin, Angie and Julie Brown ; four great grandchildren and a brother,

John Phillipich of Springfield, IL.

Helen was preceded in death by her parents and two husbands, Morris Jacob Brown and Glenn E. Hutton and a great grandchild.

Cremation services entrusted to the care of Wojstrom Funeral Home & Crematory of Granite City.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Shirley M. (Love) Smith, 82, of Granite City, IL passed away 6:40 a.m., Wednesday, May 24, 2017 at her home in

Granite City, IL.

She was born February 7, 1935 in Granite City to George and Mattie (nee: Fowler) Love.

Shirley M. Love and James O. Smith, Jr. were married on October 7, 1961 in Granite City, IL.

She owned and operated Shirts-N- Stuff in Granite City, IL. She also worked for several years at Century 21 in Granite City. Shirley was a member of Hope

Lutheran Church in Granite City, IL for over 40 years, where she served as the Sunday School Superintendent.

Survivors include two daughters, Cathleen M. (Vincent) Adler of Pocahontas, IL, Mona (David) Lindberg of Springfield, IL, son, Lacy Brazel of Granite City,

IL, four grandchildren, Robert (Amanda) Bodi, Katie (Shawn) McCall, Lacy (Jamie) Brazel and Maegan Brazel, five great-grandchildren, Noah Bodi, Connor

McCall, L.J. Brazel, Anna Brazel and Stella Brazel, and one brother, Lacy Milton of Granite City

She was preceded in death by her husband, both parents; two brothers, Dale and Bill Love and a sister, Helen.

The family will have a memorial visitation from 1:00 p.m. until time of the memorial service at 3:00 p.m., Sunday, June 4, 2017 at Hope Lutheran Church,

3715 Wabash Ave., Granite City, IL with Rev. Alan Beuster officiating.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Ronald C. Hastings Sr., 82, of Granite City, Illinois passed away at 2:10 a.m. on Saturday, May 27, 2017 at his

home.

He was born January 14, 1935 in East St. Louis, Illinois, a son of the late George and Othella (Krieg) Hastings.

He married Mildred Joyce (McGee) Hastings on October 15, 1966 in East St. Louis and she survives.

He retired from Granite City Steel with over 49 years of dedicated service as a turbine operator.

He enjoyed his days of camping, boating, piddling and cherished his grandchildren. Ronald will be remembered for the love and special times shared

with his family and friends.

In addition to his beloved wife, he is survived by five children and their spouses, Kathy Boyette of Jupiter, Florida, Julia Gibbs of Granite City, Michael and

Lisa Yarbrough of Granite City, Deanna and Kyle Smith of Granite City and Matthew and Marcy Yarbrough of Granite City; twelve grandchildren; many great

grandchildren; a sister, Evelyn Walters of Mesa, Arizona; three brothers and a sister-in-law, Bob Hastings of O'Fallon, Illinois, Tom Hastings of Kentucky

and Terry and Marsha Hastings of Shiloh; several nieces; nephews; other extended family and many friends.

In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by a son, Ronald Hastings Jr.; grandson, Roy Hogan III and a great grandson, Mason Wells.

In celebration of his life, visitation will be held at Irwin Chapel, 3960 Maryville Road in Granite City on Thursday, June 1, 2017 from 4:00 p.m. until 8:00 p.m.

where funeral services will be held on Friday, June 2, 2017 at 11:00 a.m. with Reverend Henry Crippen officiating.

Burial will be at St. John Cemetery on Maryville Road in Granite City.

Memorials may be made to the Alzheimer's Association or to St. Jude Children's Hospital and may be accepted at the funeral home.

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Patricia "Sally" Ann (Parks) McElroy passed away peacefully in her home surrounded by family at 72 years old

on May 21, 2017.

Sally was born on August 24, 1944 in Granite City, IL to the late Clifford Owen Parks, Sr and Alice Lorraine (Proffitt) Parks. She was nicknamed Sally as an

infant by her grandfather and known by Sally all her life.

Sally proudly served as a civil servant for the U.S. Air Force and U.S. Army for 42 years. She assisted in the development of over 200 recruiters that led to

their individual successes and flawlessly managed over 50 recruiting service programs. Sally was recognized as the 345th Air Force Recruiting

Squadrons Civilian of the year in 1986, 1988, and 2004. She received the Outstanding Civilian Career Service Award for exemplary service as Enlisted

Accessions, D Flight secretary for the Air Force Recruiting Squadron for service April 10, 1985 to September 1, 2007. She also received the Meritorious

Service Medal for service from January 27, 1965 to January 27, 2005 for her outstanding performance as an Operations Flight Administrator, Officer and

Enlisted Accessions Flight Administrator to the United States.

Sally loved her family. She was the matriarch of her family and is greatly missed by all. Sally was a single mom that raised her son and helped raise her 2

nephews. She worked hard to keep her family well cared for. Her son and grandson were the lights of her life. She never missed a baseball game or

hockey game that her boys played in. She taught all the kids how to drive and how to ride their brakes hard. She loved to cater and host family gatherings

and was a wonderful baker. She thoroughly enjoyed making wedding cakes for those she knew and loved.

Sally had a lot of hobbies and things that brought her joy. She was a lover of the theater, an avid reader, and a great quilter. She made a lot of quilts in her

lifetime and in the last several years was sending baby quilts to children in need. Her love for books and movie was great. Her favorite books to read were

the Little House on the Prairie series and she loved all Sci-Fi and

B-rated movies. Sally was an ardent collector and fan of Elvis Presley and even named her cat Elvis.

Sally is survived in death by her son Michael McElroy and wife Leslie, brother Clifford Parks, Jr. and wife Sharon, and brother William "Bill" Parks, Sr. and

wife Carolyn, nephew Daniel Parks and wife Kim, nephew Douglas Parks and wife Amy, niece Wendy Parks, niece Emily Highfield and husband Nicholas

and nephew William "Bill" Parks, Jr. Also surviving is her grandson Cory McElroy and partner Sheila Goff, great niece Krystle Hamblen and husband

Justin, great nephew Christopher Parks and partner Kathleen Lybarger, great niece Hannah Myers and husband Josh and great niece Ashlie Parks. In

addition, great grand daughter Isabella Clutts, great great niece Isabella Parks, great great nephew Clayton Myers and great great nephew Nicholas

Highfield. Survived also by numerous loved ones and cousins, most cherished cousin Roberta Bean and husband Rick and cousin Nancy Jacoby and

husband Bob.

Sally was truly a wonderful woman who enriched everyone's life she touched. Everyone who knew her loved her and is better for having her in their lives.

"The true way to live is to enjoy every moment as it passes, and surely it is in the everyday things around us that the beauty of life lies." - Laura Ingalls

Wilder

Memorial visitation will be held from 5:00 p.m. until 7:00 p.m. on Wednesday, May 31, 2017 at Irwin Chapel, 3960 Maryville Road, Granite City, IL.

In celebration of her life, memorial services will follow at 7:00 p.m. on Wednesday at the funeral chapel.

Memorial donations may be given to Crohn's & Colitis Foundation, 1034 South Brentwood Blvd. Suite 1510, Richmond Heights, MO 63117 and donations

will be accepted at the funeral chapel.

_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Melvin "Steve" Schleicher, age 66, of Pontoon Beach, IL, passed away on Tuesday, May 23, 2017 at his home.

Steve was born on December 18, 1950 in East St. Louis, IL, a son of the late Doris (Burns) and Robert A. Fischer and Melvin A. Schleicher.

Steve was a United States Army Veteran who proudly served his country in the United States Army. After his tour of duty of two years in the Army, Steve

reenlisted with the Army Reserves, retiring after twenty plus years of dedicated service as a Master Sergeant. Steve was also employed by the federal

government as a civil service employee, working as a supply clerk. He was always running errands and he enjoyed hunting and collecting just about

anything that caught his eye. His greatest joy was spending time with his family, especially with his grandson, Mason, whom he adored. Steve will be

sadly missed by all who knew and loved him.

He is survived by his loving children, Sarah (Jason) Leonard of Pontoon Beach, IL and Steve Pate of Largo, Florida; proud grandfather to Mason Leonard

of Pontoon Beach, IL; special friend, Martha Johnson of Belleville, IL; dear sisters, Rose E. Grosenheider of Mt. Olive, IL, Debbie Rahn and Diane DeHart;

beloved black lab and partner in crime, Jake; his buddy's from Uncle Linny's breakfast gang; extended family and many friends.

Visitation will be held from 5:00 p.m. until 8:00 p.m. on Monday, May 29, 2017 at Irwin Chapel, 3960 Maryville Road, Granite City, IL.

In celebration of his life, funeral services will be held at 10:30 a.m. on Tuesday, May 30, 2017 at Irwin Chapel, Granite City, IL. Interment will be in Jefferson

Barracks National Cemetery, St. Louis, MO, with full military honors.

Memorial donations may be given to the family to start a college scholarship fund for his grandson, Mason and donations will be accepted at the funeral

chapel.

_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Dorothy M. Beyer, age 82, of Granite City, IL, passed away on Saturday, May 20, 2017 at Clinton Manor Living

Center, New Baden, IL.

Dorothy was born on June 29, 1934 in French Village, MO, a daughter of the late Joe and Cecilia (Rulo) Riddle.

On September 18, 1954, Dorothy married Lester T. "Bud" Beyer, the love of her life in St. Louis, MO and Bud passed away on August 13, 2011. Dorothy

was a member of St. Elizabeth Catholic Church in Granite City, IL. In her younger years, she had worked for Trattler's Mens Store in Granite City, IL, in the

customer service department. Dorothy was a proud homemaker who loved being a wife, mother, grandmother and great-grandmother. She enjoyed

dancing, shopping, reading and volunteering at Maryville Elementary School in Granite City, IL. She will be sadly missed by all who knew and loved her.

In addition to her parents and husband, Dorothy was preceded in death by one grandson, John Baker Jr.

She is survived by her loving children, Jeff (Kim) Beyer of O'Fallon, IL, Don (Debbie) Beyer of Fairview Heights, IL and Valerie (David) White of Granite City,

IL; dear sister, Jackie Smith and her son, David Smith both of St. Louis, MO; proud grandmother to Michelle (Gary) Goodfellow, Benjamin (Andrea) Beyer,

Jacob Beyer, Cory Beyer, Travis Beyer and Stephen Chandler; proud great-grandmother to Jake McGowan, Blake McGowan, Brock McGowan, Caden

Goodfellow, Jaylie Goodfellow, John Robert Baker III, Jordan Baker, Samantha Beyer and Addisyn Chandler; many nieces, nephews, extended family and

many friends.

Visitation will be held from 5:00 p.m. until 8:00 p.m. on Friday, May 26, 2017 at Irwin Chapel, 3960 Maryville Road, Granite City, IL.

In celebration of her life, funeral services will be held at 10:00 a.m. on Saturday, May 27, 2017 at Irwin Chapel, Granite City, IL, with Pastor Mike Evans

officiating. Dorothy will be laid to rest next to Bud at Sunset Hill Memorial Estates, Glen Carbon, IL.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Dolores A. Jones, nee Holloway, 79, of Granite City, Ill., formerly of Pinckneyville, Ill., born July 27, 1937, in

DuQuoin, Ill., died Wednesday, May 24, 2017, in Granite City, Ill.

Ms. Jones was a homemaker, St. Louis Cardinals fan, avid reader, absolutely loved her family and spending time with them, a devout Christian, and

believed in the power of prayer.

She was preceded in death by her parents, William Douglas and Lillie Mae, nee Childers, Holloway; spouse, Alva Dean Jones, whom she married March

17, 1954; and brothers, Robert Lee Holloway, and James Holloway.

Surviving are her sons, Jeffrey Dean (Cheryl) Jones of Granite City, Ill., and David Lee (Cordean) Jones of Granite City, Ill.; sister, Diane Wright of

Pinckneyville, Ill.; grandchildren, Jamie (Michael) Barrett of Granite City, Ill., Christopher Jones of Granite City, Ill., Melinda Jones of Granite City, Ill., and

Brent Lyons of Glen Carbon, Ill.; and great grandchildren, Jackson and Mackenzie Barrett of Granite City, Ill.

Memorials may be made to the Muscular Dystrophy Association and will be accepted at the funeral home.

Visitation: Friends may call from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. on Saturday, May 27, 2017, at Irwin Chapel, 3960 Maryville Road in Granite City, Ill.

Funeral: A celebration of her life will be held at 1 p.m. on Saturday, May 27, 2017, at the funeral home. Burial will be in Sunset Hill Memorial Estates, Glen

Carbon, Ill.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Carolyn Sue Sampson, 68, of Granite City, Illinois passed away on Wednesday, May 17, 2017 at her home.

She was born April 28, 1949 in Edwardsville, a daughter of the late Lawrence Casey and Marjorie Ellen (Schrier) Sampson.

She loved reading and was very spiritual and cherished angels around her.

She is survived by two daughters, Leyla (David) Harrell of Alton and Jolie Sampson (Carter) of Alton; one son, Cody Sampson of Cahokia; five

grandchildren, Anastacia, Domonic, Avery, Dante and Izzabelle; other extended family and friends.

In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by a sister, Mary Johanna Sampson.

In celebration of her life, memorial visitation will be at Living Water Church of God, 822 Mildred Avenue in Cahokia on Saturday, May 27, 2017 from 2:00 p.

m. until time of memorial service at 3:00 p.m. with Reverend Larry Ridenour officiating.

Memorials may be made to the family.

____________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Mildred Sturgeon, age 87, of Granite City, IL, passed away on Tuesday, May 23, 2017 at Anderson Hospital,

Maryville, IL.

Mildred was born on July 13, 1929 in Tamms, IL, a daughter of the late Ganaway and Mary Martin.

Mildred had worked for Owen Glass Works in Alton, IL for many years. She enjoyed fishing and camping. Her greatest joy was spending time with her

family. Mildred loved life, she loved to laugh, but most of all she loved her family. She will be sadly missed by all who knew and loved her.

In addition to her parents, Mildred was preceded in death by her brothers and sisters.

She is survived by her loving children, William (Ruby) Sturgeon Sr. of Cullman, AL, Rosemary (Gary) Kampmann of Glen Carbon, IL, Eddie (Dawn)

Sturgeon of Granite City, IL, Susie Crossno of Granite City, IL and Jeri Lovins of Abilene, TX; proud grandmother to 21 grandchildren, 51 great-

grandchildren and 7 great-great grandchildren; many nieces, nephews, extended family and friends.

Visitation will be held from 5:00 p.m. until 8:00 p.m. on Friday, May 26, 2017 at Irwin Chapel, 591 Glen Crossing Road, Glen Carbon, IL.

In celebration of her life, funeral services will be held at 10:00 a.m. on Saturday, May 27, 2017 at Irwin Chapel, Glen Carbon, IL. Interment will be in St.

John Cemetery on Maryville Road, Granite City, IL.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Carla Joyce Wright, 74, of Granite City, Illinois passed away at 11:02 a.m. on Sunday, May 21, 2017 at Gateway

Regional Medical Center in Granite City.

She was born October 16, 1942 in Qulin, Missouri, a daughter of the late G.W. Cook and Dorothy (Peal) Linenberg.

She married Leonard Verle "Hotshot" Wright on February 27, 1958 in Granite City and he passed away on January 2, 2011.

She retired in 1993 from Wal-Mart in Granite City after several years of service and had worked many years of dedicated service in retail at Queens Wear

Boutique in Granite City.

She was a member of Calvary Baptist Church in Granite City and the Venice Social Club. She cherished her daughter and grandchildren and was known

to be very proper and coordinated. She will be remembered for the love and special times shared with her family and friends.

She is survived by a daughter and son-in-law, Kellie and Grant White of Granite City; four grandchildren, Zane Francis, Shelby White, Sara White and Grant

White Jr.; a sister, Gerry Ramey of Centralia; brother-in-law and his significant other, Nyle "Wayne" Wright and Marilyn Rice of Granite City; sister-in-law,

Lois Essenpreis of Granite City; many nieces; nephews; cousins; other extended family and friends.

In celebration of her life, visitation will be at Calvary Baptist Church, 3000 Washington Avenue in Granite City on Friday, May 26, 2017 from 10:00 a.m. until

time of funeral service at 12:00 noon with Reverend Jesse Tedder officiating.

Burial will be at Sunset Hill Memorial Estates in Glen Carbon.

Memorials may be made to the American Kidney Foundation.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Sharon M. Rickert, age 75, of Granite City, IL, passed away on Friday, May 19, 2017 at her home.

Sharon was born on June 14, 1941 in St. Louis, MO, a daughter of the late William and Grace (McCullough) Lamping.

On August 13, 1966, Sharon married Edward Rickert, the love of her life. Sharon was a faithful member of St. Elizabeth Catholic Church in Granite City, IL.

She had worked as a registered nurse at St. John Mercy Hospital in St. Louis, MO for many years. Sharon loved being a wife, mother, grandmother and a

great-grandmother. Her greatest joy was taking care of her family. She will be sadly missed by all who knew and loved her.

In addition to her parents, Sharon was preceded in death by two brothers, Bill and Jack Lamping.

She is survived by her devoted husband of fifty years, Edward Rickert of Granite City, IL; loving children, William (Heather) Rickert of Pontoon Beach, IL and

Kerry (Jim) Flanary of Granite City, IL; proud grandmother to Emily (Ricky) Boyer of Granite City, IL, Drew Rickert of Beckemeyer, IL, Sydney Rickert of

Beckemeyer, IL and Magdalena Hochuli of Pontoon Beach, IL; proud great-grandmother to Aubree and Caleb Boyer of Granite City, IL; dear brother, Jim

Lamping of New Orleans, LA; extended family and many friends.

Visitation will be held from 5:00 p.m. until 8:00 p.m. on Monday, May 22, 2017 at Irwin Chapel, 3960 Maryville Road, Granite City, IL.

In celebration of her life, a funeral mass will be held at 10:00 a.m. on Tuesday, May 23, 2017 at St. Elizabeth Catholic Church, Granite City, IL, with Father

Chris Comerford officiating. Interment will be in Calvary Catholic Cemetery, Edwardsville, IL.

Memorial donations may be given to St. Elizabeth Catholic School and donations will be accepted at the funeral chapel.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Judith Ann Howard, 74, of Granite City died on Thursday, May 11, 2017 at Stearns Nursing and Rehab Center

in Granite City.

She was born on April 9, 1943 in South Milwaukee, WI to Montgomery Howard and Lorraine (Chay) Grulkowski.

The loving mother enjoyed thrift store shopping, watching American Pickers, sketching and spending time in her flower garden.

She was a secretary for many years at Hazeltine Nursery from which she retired.

Judith is survived by a daughter, Ginger (David) Sirois of Granite City; a son, John C. Tapp of Punta Gorda, FL; 3 grandchildren: John Lee Tapp, Paul

Cossum, and Ashlee Sirois and 1 great grandchild, Peyton Dietz.

Besides her parents, Judith is preceded in death by 2 brothers: Fred Howard and Charles Howard.

Cremation services entrusted to the care of Wojstrom Funeral Home & Crematory of Granite City.

_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Jerry Wayne Legate, age 70, of Granite City, IL, passed away on Sunday, May 7, 2017 at his home, with his

family by his side.

Jerry was born on March 5, 1947 in Granite City, IL, a son of the late John Elbert Legate and Pauline (Self) Legate Gibson.

Jerry was a Vietnam Veteran who proudly served his country in the United States Army. On July 26, 1974, Jerry married Judith Ann Freeman, the love of his

life in Granite City, IL. He had retired from Dow Chemical in Madison, IL after thirty years of dedicated service. After retiring, Jerry went to work at the

National Guard Armory in East St. Louis, IL as a grounds keeper. In his younger years, he enjoyed going fishing and hunting. His greatest joy was

spending time with his family, especially with his grandchildren, whom he adored. Jerry will be sadly missed by all who knew and loved him.

In addition to his parents, Jerry was preceded in death by his step-father, Floyd Gibson; and by four brothers and two sisters.

He is survived by his devoted wife, Judith Ann Legate of Granite City, IL; loving children, John Freeman of Missouri and Jeff (Jasmine) Legate of Granite

City, IL; dear sisters, Joyce Danner and Peggy Sue Collins both of New Jersey; proud grandfather to Jessica, Samantha, Christopher, Elizabeth, Rebecca

and Alex; extended family and many dear friends.

In celebration of his life, graveside services will be held at Jefferson Barracks National Cemetery, St. Louis, MO, with full military honors at a later date.

Memorial donations may be given to Critical Nurse Staff, Inc, for energy workers.

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Jack Lee Carpenter, 75, of Granite City, Illinois passed away at 9:52 p.m. on Friday, May 12, 2017 in the

emergency department at Gateway Regional Medical Center in Granite City.

In celebration of his life, visitation will be at Irwin Chapel, 3960 Maryville Road in Granite City on Wednesday, May 17, 2017 from 4:00 p.m. until time of

funeral service at 7:00 p.m. with Reverend Henry Crippen officiating.

Memorials may be made to the Granite City APA or to Make-a-Wish Foundation and may be accepted at the funeral home.

_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

RoseMarie Vizer, age 87, of Granite City, IL, passed away on Thursday, May 11, 2017 at Meridian Village, Glen

Carbon, IL. RoseMarie was born on April 11, 1930 in Granite City, IL, a daughter of the late John and Rose

(Hornyak-Baki) Chepley.

On May 23, 1953, RoseMarie married Joseph O. Vizer, the love of her life in Granite City, IL and Joseph passed away on November 11, 1992. RoseMarie

was a faithful member of Holy Family Catholic Church in Granite City, IL. She was a proud homemaker who enjoyed making ceramics, embroidery and

cooking. RoseMarie also enjoyed camping in her younger years with her family. Her greatest joy was spending time with her family, especially with her

grandchildren and great-grandchildren, whom she adored. RoseMarie loved life, she loved to laugh, but most of all she loved her family. She will be sadly

missed by all who knew and loved her.

In addition to her parents and husband, RoseMarie was preceded in death by her son-in-law, Monty Stagner.

She is survived by her loving children, Timothy (Karen) Vizer of Belleville, IL, Daniel Vizer of Granite City, IL and Peggy Ann Stagner of Granite City, IL; proud

grandmother to Monika (Robert) Kavran of Belleville, IL, Matthew Vizer of Belleville and Paisley Stagner of Granite City, IL; proud great-grandmother to

Emma and Lucas Kavran both of Belleville, IL; and many dear friends.

Visitation will be held from 4:00 p.m. until 8:00 p.m. on Monday, May 15, 2017 at Irwin Chapel, 2801 Madison Ave, Granite City, IL.

In celebration of her life, a funeral mass will be held at 10:00 a.m. on Tuesday, May 16, 2017 at Holy Family Catholic Church, Granite City, IL, with Father

Jeff Holtman officiating. RoseMarie will be laid to rest next to Joseph at Calvary Catholic Cemetery, Edwardsville, IL.

Memorial donations may be given to St. Jude Children's Hospital and donations will be accepted at the funeral chapel.

Condolences may be expressed to the family online at www.irwinchapel.com.

_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Patricia L. "Pat" Waldo, 86, of Granite City, Illinois passed away at 3:45 a.m. on Saturday, May 13, 2017 at her

home.

She was born February 5, 1931 in Cairo, Missouri, a daughter of the late Howard and Marie (Gasche) McKinney.

She married Gayland R. Waldo on July 10, 1954 in Hillsboro, Missouri and he survives.

She was a loving homemaker and had also worked with Follman Properties with several years as a bookkeeper.

Pat was a devoted and faithful member of the Mitchell First Baptist Church since 1962 and had served as a Sunday school teacher, organist and the

Church clerk for many years. She was a volunteer with Mitchell School giving many hours for the children assisting them with reading and serving as a

room mother. She enjoyed her days of sewing and camping and cherished her grandchildren. She will be remembered for the love and special times

shared with her entire family and many friends.

In addition to her beloved husband of nearly 63 years, she is survived by three children and spouses, Gail and Dan Minkus of Glen Ellyn, Mike and Diane

Waldo of Moro and Kathy Pease of Wheaton; seven grandchildren, Sam Waldo, Adam Waldo, Jeff Minkus, Kevin Minkus, Derek Minkus, Matt Johnson and

Kelsey Pease; two great grandchildren, Ellie and Nico; two sisters, Mary McKinney and Jane McKinney, both of Hillsboro, Missouri; three sisters-in-law

and a brother-in-law, Sandy McKinney of Hillsboro, Missouri, Virginia and Art Anderson of Flushing, Michigan and Butch Waldo of Clarksville, Arkansas;

many nieces; nephews; other extended family and many friends.

In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by two brothers, Maurice and Charles McKinney.

In celebration of her life, visitation will be at Irwin Chapel, 3960 Maryville Road in Granite City on Monday, May 15, 2017 from 5:00 p.m. until 8:00 p.m.

where funeral services will be at 10:00 a.m. on Tuesday, May 16, 2017 with Reverend Richard Harmon officiating.

Burial will be at Sunset Hill Memorial Estates in Glen Carbon.

Memorials may be made to St. John's Community Care in Collinsville and may be accepted at the funeral home.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________

John "Jack" Hennrich, 89, of Granite City, Illinois passed away at 2:20 p.m. on Thursday, May 11, 2017 at

DeGreef Hospice House in St. Louis, Missouri.

He was born April 16, 1928 in Terre Haute, Indiana, the son of the late Hubert and Grace (McGee) Hennrich.

He married Marian F. (Alessandrelli) Hennrich on November 25, 1950 at Sacred Heart Catholic Church in Granite City and she passed away on April 24,

2007.

He retired as a meat cutter and had many years of service in several grocery stores throughout the local area.

He proudly served his country with the United States Navy. He was a faithful member of St. Elizabeth Catholic Church and was raised in the Sacred Heart

Parish. He was also a member of Senior Circle, Eagles Aerie #1126 and the Knights of Columbus Tri-Cities Council #1098 and enjoyed his days of

traveling and watching the St. Louis Cardinals. He will be remembered for the love and special times shared with his family and friends.

He is survived by a daughter and son-in-law, Cathy and Ken Janish of Leawood, Kansas; two sons and a daughter-in-law, Alan Hennrich of Maryville and

Tom and Terri Hennrich of St. Louis; four grandchildren and spouses, Katie and Ryan Burke, Laura Hennrich, Andy and Jessica Janish and Jennifer and

Gary Carmack; five great grandchildren, Avery, Cason, Marian, Emma and Max; special friend, Marilyn Zeller of Granite City; other extended family and

friends.

In celebration of his life, visitation will be at St. Elizabeth Catholic Church in Granite City on Monday, May 15, 2017 from 9:30 a.m. until time of funeral mass

at 10:30 a.m. with Father Chris Comerford as celebrant.

Burial with full military honors will be at Jefferson Barracks National Cemetery in St. Louis.

Memorials may be made to the DeGreef Hospice House and payable to St. Anthony's Charitable Foundation, 10024 Kennerly Road, St. Louis, MO 63128

_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________.

June Rose Thweatt, 86, of Granite City, IL, passed away at 5:40 p.m. Fri. May 5, 2017 at Stearns Nursing &

Rehab in Granite City.

She was born June 13, 1930 in Granite City, IL to the late Joseph & Julia (Cizik) Varge.

On Feb. 14, 1948, she and Terry James Thweatt were married in Madison, IL. He preceded her in death Oct. 26, 2008.

She had been a member of Word of Life Tabernacle.

MARGARET "MAGGIE" CATHERINE (ROGERS) MAC ZURA, AGE 90, OF GRANITE CITY, IL, PASSED AWAY ON

MAY 3, 2017, AT MERIDIAN VILLAGE, GLEN CARBON, IL.

MARGARET WAS BORN ON APRIL 18, 1927 IN ST.LOUIS, MO. A DAUGHTER OF THE LATE HAROLD AND MARGARET (SMITH) ROGERS SCOTT.

ON JUNE 23, 1945, MARGARET MARRIED WARREN (Pete) MacZuraAT SACRED HEART (HOLY FAMILY) CATHOLIC CHURCH IN GRANITE CITY, IL. HE

PRECEDED HER IN DEATH ON JULY 22, 2000, AFTER 55 YEARS OF MARRIAGE. SHE WAS ALSO PRECEDED IN DEATH BY HER SISTER, HAROLDINE

ROSS SEIBERT, SON-IN- LAW, CHARLES (BOB) BETTS AND STEP-FATHER, JOHN SCOTT.

MARGARET HAD A DEEP FONDNESS FOR MUSIC AND DANCING. WHEN SHE WAS IN THE THIRD GRADE, SHE SANG HER FIRST SOLO. DURING

HER HIGH SCHOOL YEARS, SHE AND HER THREE SISTERS APPEARED IN VARIETY SHOWS FOR CIVIC, CHARITABLE, CHURCH, HOSPITALS AND

SOCIAL GROUPS THROUGHOUT THE STATES OF ILLINOIS AND MISSOURI. HER GREATEST MEMORY WAS PERFORMING IN VARIETY SHOWS, WITH

HER SISTERS, SINGING AND PLAYING MUSICAL INSTRUMENTS FOR THE WW2 WOUNDED VETS AT SCOTT AIR FORCE BASE.

MARGARET WAS A FAITHFUL MEMBER OF SACRED HEART (HOLY FAMILY) CHURCH, WHERE SHE WAS A MEMBER OF THE CHOIR. SHE ALSO SANG

WITH THE MASTER'S VOICE COMMUNITY CHOIR. SHE SANG FOR WEDDINGS, FUNERALS AND SOCIAL FUNCTIONS. SHE WAS A PAST MEMBER OF

F.O.E. 1126, THE EAGLE'S KITCHEN BAND AND LATER, "RUTHIE'S RAG TIME GAL'S", SHE PERFORMED ON THE CHARLOTTE PETERS TELEVISION

SHOW AND ON THE RUSS DAVID RADIO PROGRAM. SHE EARNED THE NICKNAME OF "BIRD" FROM HER OLDEST SON, BECAUSE SHE WAS

ALWAYS SINGING.

MARGARET WORKED FOR 12 YEARS AT ST. ELIZABETH'S HOSPITAL (GATEWAY), AS THE WELLS TELEVISION REPRESENTATIVE. SHE THEN

WORKED ANOTHER 12 YEARS AT AMERICAN HERITAGE BANK, RETIRING IN 1990. SHE ALSO WAS RECORDING SECRETARY FOR LOCAL 520

OPERATING ENGINEERS, WHERE HER HUSBAND RETIRED FROM.

OVER THEIR 55 YEARS OF MARRIAGE, MARGARET WAS INVOLVED IN HER HUSBAND'S SCALE MODEL AIRPLANE CLUB, GOING TO MEETS WHERE

HER HUSBAND AND SONS FLEW MODEL AIRPLANES. SHE WAS EXTREMELY PROUD OF HER HUSBAND, WHEN HE WON THE WORLD

CHAMPIONSHIP FOR ONE OF HIS SCALE MODEL AIRPLANES, WHICH IS NOW IN THE MODEL AIRPLANE HALL OF FAME IN MUNCIE, INDIANA. SOME

OF HER FONDEST MEMORIES WERE PACKING UP THE CAR ON A MOMENTS NOTICE TO GO CAMPING OR TO AIRPLANE MEETS. SHE LOVED

WORKING IN HER YARD, WAS AN AVID SWIMMER, AND LOVED TO DANCE! SHE AND HER HUSBAND TRAVELED NUMEROUS TIMES TO SEE THEIR

CHILDREN WHO LIVED OUT OF STATE. SHE LOVED CARING FOR HER GRAND AND GREATGRANDCHILDREN. HER KINDNESS AND HER GREAT

BIG HUGS WERE TRADEMARKS OF HER PERSONALITY. SHE EARNED THE NICKNAME OF "SUNSHINE" FROM HER FATHER, BECAUSE SHE

BROUGHT SUNSHINE TO EVEN A RAINY DAY.

SHE IS SURVIVED AND SADLY MISSED, BY HER SONS, ROGER (JUDY) OF HELL, MICHIGAN, TERRY (MARILYNN) OF COLLINSVILLE, ILLINOIS, DAVID

MAC ZURA OF TULSA, OKLAHOMA , AND DAUGHTER, MEG BETTS OF GRANITE CITY, ILLINOIS. SHE LEAVES EIGHT GRANDCHILDREN, TWO

STEPGRANDCHILDREN AND ELEVEN GREATGRANDCHILDREN, TWO SISTERS, SHIRLEY (ALBERT) KIBORT OF GRANITE CITY AND JOYCE HALL,

OF GLEN CARBON, AND NUMEROUS NIECES AND NEPHEWS.

VISITATION WILL BE HELD FROM 5:00 P.M. UNTIL 8:00PM ON MAY 9 AT IRWIN CHAPEL, 3960 MARYVILLE ROAD, GRANITE CITY, IL. IN CELEBRATION

OF HER LIFE, A FUNERAL MASS WILL BE HELD AT 10:00A.M. ON MAY 10, 2017 AT HOLY FAMILY CATHOLIC CHURCH. MARGARET WILL BE LAID TO

REST NEXT TO PETE AT CALVARY CATHOLIC CEMETERY, EDWARDSVILLE, IL. IN LIEU OF FLOWERS, DONATIONS MAY BE GIVEN TO CARDINAL

GLENNON CHILDREN'S HOSPITAL AND DONATIONS WILL BE ACCEPTED AT THE FUNERAL CHAPEL.

CONDOLENCES MAY BE EXPRESSED TO THE FAMILY ONLINE AT www.irwinchapel.com

Tom L. Grimes, age 77, of Granite City, IL, passed away on Sunday, April 16, 2017 at Barnes Hospital, St. Louis,

MO.

Tom was born on October 5, 1939 in Granite City, IL, a son of the late Lester and Lorraine (Ashby) Grimes.

Tom had graduated from Madison, IL high school in 1957. Tom was a faithful member of Holy Family Catholic Church in Granite City, IL. He had

worked for the Illinois Department of Transportation as an engineering technician, retiring after thirty-five years of dedicated service in 1992.

Following his retirement from I.D.O.T., Tom was employed by the cities of Granite City, IL, Maryville, IL, Venice, IL and Juneau Associates as a

resident engineer on numerous street improvement contracts. He was also employed as a project engineer on parts of the Metrolink construction in

St. Clair County. Tom ended his working career in 2006. He was a 4th Degree member of Knights of Columbus #1098 in Granite City, IL, Illinois

Association of Professional Engineers and the Retired State Employees Association. Tom was an avid St. Louis Cardinal Baseball fan, St. Louis

Blues hockey fan and he loved playing golf and bowling. In his younger years he coached little league baseball teams. His greatest joy was spending

time with his family and friends. Tom loved life, he loved to laugh, but most of all he loved his family. He will be sadly missed by all who knew and

loved him.

Former Mayor of Granite City, Ronald "Ron" L. Selph, 70, of Granite City, Illinois, passed away at 3:22 a.m. due

to heart failure on Monday, April 10, 2017 at Gateway Regional Medical Center.

Ron was born July 13, 1946 in Granite City, IL to the late Roby and Lucille (Gordon) Selph. He graduated from Granite City High School in 1964 and

from McKendree College in 1978. Ron joined the United States Coast Guard after high school. After serving his country, he went back home to

Granite City where he had a 20 year successful career as a police officer. He was married to the former Karen W. Whittaker until her passing in

June 2015. He then served two years with the U.S. Marshal Service. During this time he also taught criminal justice classes at Belleville Area College

for 17 years. In 1993, Ron made the decision to run for Mayor of Granite City and won. He considered his time as Mayor to be his greatest

accomplishment and was honored to serve in that position for the next 12 years until his retirement. He enjoyed serving his community in any

capacity and said it was "the people" that he enjoyed the most. He loved to fish and golf. Spending time with family was his favorite pastime after

retirement.

Ron is survived by a daughter, Terri L. (Tito) Selph-Tamez; a son, Ronald W. (Lea Anne) Selph; five grandchildren, Karen Robbins, Austin Weaver,

Tanner Selph, Shaelyn Selph and Presley Selph; one great-grandchild, Rylee L. Hubbard; eight siblings, Judie Cor of Hacienda Heights, CA, Kathy

(Jim) Robins, Debbie (Ron) Reeves of Granite City, Jackie Ortiz, Sally Strong of Caseyville, IL, Danny (Laurie) Selph, John (Tammy) Selph of Granite

City and Craig (Barbara) Selph of Hagerstown, MD.; twenty-three nieces and nephews; other extended family and many friends.

In celebration of his life, visitation will be at Irwin Chapel, 3960 Maryville Road in Granite City on Thursday, April 13, 2017 from 4:00 p.m. until 8:00 p.m.

where funeral services will be held on Friday, April 14, 2017 at 11:00 a.m. with Reverend Timothy O'Keefe officiating.

Burial with military honors will follow at St. John Cemetery on Maryville Road in Granite City.

Memorials may be made to Coordinated Youth and Human Services, 2016 Madison Avenue, Granite City, Illinois 62040 and may be accepted at the

funeral home.
